text: News | Living & Travel 29 Dec 2023 11:05 | outlook hotmail | yahoo mail | gmail | news | weather | finance | shopping | about nzcity | Search | NZCity News SEARCH Google Bing NZ News NewsLinks the White Pages NZ Street Names the Yellow Pages Yahoo NZ Web sites SearchNZ NZ Domain Names CUSTOMISE Start Page Personalise News Top Stories Business Sports Politics Health & Safety Law and Order Technology Education Living & Travel Entertainment Motoring Environment National International Accidents Maori Rural Local Politics Sport Weather Finance Shopping Jobs Horoscopes Lotto Results Photo Gallery Site Gallery TVNow Dating SearchNZ NZSearch Crime.co.nz RugbyLeague Make Home About NZCity Contact NZCity Your Privacy Advertising Login Join for Free Home > News > Living & Travel Regional airline Sounds Air is celebrating reaching pre-covid levels, thanks to strong demand this year Regional airline Sounds Air is celebrating reaching pre-covid levels, thanks to strong demand this year 29 December 2023 The airline operates 10 aircraft - with bookings on the 45 minute Christchurch to Wanaka flight particularly strong. Managing Director Andrew Crawford says building up again, hasn't come without challenges. He says fuel and maintenance has been tricky, but he hopes prices will drop down next year and is looking forward to 2024. >> More Living & Travel News © 2023 Newstalk ZB, NZCity Other Living & Travel News 29 Dec: The new 'holiday highway' is no match for busy holiday congestion 28 Dec: Invercargill Mayor Nobby Clark will undergo a quadruple bypass heart surgery next week 27 Dec: Police are appealing for sightings of a missing 32 year old Auckland man 27 Dec: Spirit Airlines apologises after putting unaccompanied six-year-old on wrong flight 27 Dec: Emergency vets are starting to see an annual spike in accidental treat consumption among pets 27 Dec: Auckland businesses are thought to be holding out for the good times over summer 27 Dec: Chris Hipkins plans on catching up with former minister and MP Kiri Allan over summer Top Stories RUGBY World number five Gerwyn Price is out of the World Darts Championship - upset 4 sets to 2 by Northern Ireland's Brendan Dolan More...
